text: The 1999–00 LEN Champions League is the 37th edition of LEN's premier competition for men's water polo clubs. It ran from 27 October 1999 to 27 May 2000, and it is contested by 28 teams. The Final Four (semifinals, final, and third place game) took place on May 26 and May 27 in Bečej. ==Preliminary round== {| class="wikitable" |- !Key to colors in group tables |- style="background:#cfc;" |Group winners and runners-up advanced to Final four |} ===Blue Group=== ===Red Group=== ==Final Four (Bečej)== ===Final standings=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! width=25| !! width=220|Team |- | 15px ||align=left| Bečej |- | 15px ||align=left| HAVK Mladost |- | 15px ||align=left| BVSC |- | ||align=left| POŠK |} {| style="text-align: center; margin-top: 2em; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto" |- |Aleksandar Šoštar, Predrag Zimonjić, Slobodan Soro, Goran Krstonošić, Nenad Vukanić, Branko Peković, Aleksandar Ćirić, Veljko Uskoković, László Tóth, Aleksandar Šapić, Jugoslav Vasović, Balázs Vincze, Nebojša Milić |- |Head Coach |- |Zoltán Kásás |} ==See also== *1999–00 LEN Cup Winners' Cup *1999–00 LEN Cup Category:LEN Champions League seasons Champions League Category:1999 in water polo Category:2000 in water polo
title: 1999–2000 LEN Champions League
